newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: INVESTEC AT NEW HIGH AFTER STRONG RESULTS.
newsitem.headline: INVESTEC AT NEW HIGH AFTER STRONG RESULTS.

text.p: Shares in Investec Bank Ltd hit a new all-time high on Tuesday, driven by a 36 percent surge in half-year share earnings announced after the close on Monday, dealers said.
In early trade Investec rose to 115 rand from 114 rand at the start, before shedding a few cents to 113.50 rand -- 50 cents or 0.44 percent up from Monday's closing price.
Volume traded by 0845 GMT was 31,500 shares.
"The market is extremely pleased with Investec. The first half results were fantastic and it will continue to perform very well," one dealer said.

Investec posted first half diluted earnings per share of 247 cents compared to 189.1 cents previously. Attributable income for the same period surged to 150.90 million rand from 98 million rand. The half-year dividend rose a third to 100 cents per share.
The group said it was confident that it would continue to show growth in earnings and dividends consistent with its historic performance.
